channel.title: CVE Feed for The Linux Foundation -- kernel:
channel.description: The latest CVEs for The Linux Foundation -- kernel:

item.title: CVE-2018-16882|2024-08-05T10:32:54.168Z -- the%20linux%20foundation -- kernel%3A
item.description: A use-after-free issue was found in the way the Linux kernel's KVM hypervisor processed posted interrupts when nested(=1) virtualization is enabled. In nested_get_vmcs12_pages(), in case of an error while processing posted interrupt address, it unmaps the 'pi_desc_page' without resetting 'pi_desc' descriptor address, which is later used in pi_test_and_clear_on(). A guest user/process could use this flaw to crash the host kernel resulting in DoS or potentially gain privileged access to a system. Kernel versions before 4.14.91 and before 4.19.13 are vulnerable.
